items.title: Three Things We Saw In Notre Dame’s Win Over Purdue
items.summary: Another year, another vengeful slaughter of the poor Purdue Boilermakers in the aftermath of a painful loss for Notre Dame (in this case, two losses). It says more about the state of Purdue football than Notre Dame, but it is still amusing as someone who grew up with this being an often competitive annual matchup […]

items.title: How Notre Dame’s opponents fared in week 4 of the college football season
items.summary: Notre Dame is off to a rough start in 2025, but they looked like they fixed a few things in a 56-30 win over the Purdue Boilermakers. Sitting at 1-2 and ranked #22 in the AP Top 25, the irish have a lot of work ahead of them to get into the college football playoff. […]

items.title: Notre Dame Football: Irish move up two spots in the AP Top 25
items.summary: The Notre Dame Fighting Irish dropped the hammer on the Purdue Boilermakers to avenge (in some ways) their 0-2 start to the season. Offensively, the Irish scored touchdowns on 6 of its first 8 drives with the non-touchdown drives being a fumble on the first play, and the end of the half (possession was just […]

items.title: #24 Notre Dame Fighting Irish VS Purdue Boilermakers: Staff Picks
items.summary: The Notre Dame Fighting Irish play host to the Purdue Boilermakers on Saturday for the Shillelagh Trophy. It really is PLAYOFF FOOTBALL for the Irish as one more loss this season will knock them out of the race for the 12 team tournament. So… it’s basically last year — right? Not exactly, but this is […]

items.title: Notre Dame Football: Purdue Boilermakers Q&A with Hammer and Rails
items.summary: My friends, I have some really bad news — in just a couple days, we will once again be subjected to watching this Notre Dame Fighting Irish football team play the sport they have seemingly forgotten how to excel at, considering their losses to Miami and Texas A&M to open the year 0-2. The Irish, […]

items.title: Throwback Thursday: Notre Dame Fighting Irish VS Purdue 1964
items.summary: The 1964 season marked the dawn of the Ara Parseghian era, and with it, a new sense of hope and discipline for Notre Dame football. Coming off a thrilling win over Wisconsin, the Irish faced a fierce test in their home opener against Purdue, a team led by rising star Bob Griese. What unfolded in […]

items.title: EARNED 5-STAR PODCAST: Notre Dame should push the 10 wins in a row button
items.summary: Joshua, Jude, and Brendan are back in the fold to talk about the Notre Dame football program — which is currently 0-2 and ranked #24 in the nation. In this episode: And plenty more weaved in and out of the show. Please RATE and REVIEW! Any review left on Apple Podcasts will be ready on […]
